post_text: Adeline Terpstra is being honored for creating the class of 2020 senior mural, as she was the artist selected among her class for her artistry and inspiration. When the shutdown occurred in March, she took the mural home and finished the work in quarantine. Her inspiration derives from the phrase, "It's a jungle out there." She also noted a passion for painting animals. The vivid colors, realistic texture, and intricate details makes this work extraordinary. She has created many influential works over her four years at PHS and in Kendall's dual enrollment program. This special mural will be displayed in the halls at Plainwell High School for many years to come. In the fall she plans to attend KVCC to study culinary. We wish Adeline all the best! Trojan pride!

Dear Families,

Dear Parents & Guardians,

Per the executive order from the Governor, starting tomorrow all staff will stay home unless otherwise designated. Based on this executive order Food Service will continue to provide meals for students on the current posted schedule through spring break. The district will also ensure buildings are secure and operating, central office will be closed but will maintain limited designated staff based on need to complete necessary tasks only (financials, bills, payroll, communications). We will continue to work with parents and students as needed online, through email, YouTube, and various other platforms. We will do our absolute best to support you and encourage you and your children to stick to as normal a routine as you can develop over the next three weeks. We are expecting some clarification from the State on Wednesday regarding make-up days and other questions, but this is still a moving target. When we know the answers we will get them to you as soon as we are able. Take care of you and yours. GO TROJANS!!

Matthew J. M. Montange
Superintendent
